issue.title: chore: add bundle size diff to metamaskbot
issue.body:
## Explanation This PR adds Bundle size diff between the `PR branch` and latest on `develop` and shows an alert if the bundle size of `common` + `background` is increased since last version on develop. ## More Information * Fixes #16070 ## Manual Testing Steps After pushing to a PR, if the build is successful the Metamask bot should also show the following section:
Bundle size diffs [🚀 Bundle size reduced! 🚀]
  • background: -4
  • ui: -37940
  • common: -4
## Pre-Merge Checklist - [x] PR template is filled out - [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added - [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue - [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone ### + If there are functional changes: - [x] Manual testing complete & passed - [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: wip: make network test helpers general to the provider type
issue.body:
Tests are all passing, but Ive commented out / singled out failing tests and wrapped them in an `if () {}`

Notes:

---
### Error format is different when hitting the max number of retries.

createJsonRpcClient error.message:
```
"JsonRpcEngine: Response has no error or result for request:
    {
      \"id\": 1280808420295549,
      \"jsonrpc\": \"2.0\",
      \"params\": [],
      \"method\": \"eth_getBlockByHash\"
    }"
```

createInfuraClient error.message:
```
InfuraProvider - cannot complete request. All retries exhausted.
    Original Error:
    {
      \"code\": -32603,
      \"message\": \"Gateway timeout. The request took too long to process. This can happen when querying logs over too wide a block range.\",
      \"stack\": \"Error: Gateway timeout. The request took too long to process. This can happen when querying logs over too wide a block range.\\n    at getEthJsonRpcError ( BIG LONG STACK TRACE INTO eth-json-rpc-errors
    }·
    "
```

#### examples of ignoring tests because of this:
- [testsForRpcMethodAssumingNoBlockParam -> `causes a request to fail with a custom error if the request to ${providerType} provider returns a ${httpStatus} response 5 times in a row`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R367)
- [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `causes a request to fail with a custom error if the request to ${providerType} provider returns a ${httpStatus} response 5 times in a row`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1096)


---

### Caching inconsistencies

#### examples
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `hits ${providerType} provider and does not reuse the result of a previous request if the latest block number was updated since`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R741)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `reuses the result of a previous request even if the latest block number was updated since`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1287)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> 'when setting blockParamType === earliest'](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1367)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `given a block tag of "pending"`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1515)

---

issue.title: Fix approve transaction call in _onBootCleanUp
issue.body:
Fixes: https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/issues/16368

The PR fixes issue in transaction controller. It seems that currently this is causing error which is caught by sentry. The transaction were completed.

issue.title: [Bug]: Balance does not update on duplicate chainId network #13690

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body: ## Explanation Currently, the balance of an account won't update if the network selected has a chainId that is already present in Metamask. That happens because in account-tracker.js there is a check for chainId and if it belonged to known networks ( as in this case it was Ropsten network) it called the method that checked balance on Ropsten network and not localhost as it should. In order to solve this problem, I added if statement that checks if rpcUrl is localhost and in that case the right method (updateBalance) is being called. ## More information * Fixes #13690 ## Screenshots/Screencaps ### Before ### After

issue.title: Fix issue with awaiting swaps page

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
## Explanation

Currently when the service worker is terminated  immediately after a swap is initiated the `SwapsController` controlled `swapsState` is reset and so the `quotes` empty out along with other `fetchParams` causing a redirect:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L505  . So if you don't quickly hit the `swap` button on the `view quotes` page after terminating the SW you will be redirected back to the `build-quote` page:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34557516/199344799-5e705e69-f459-4f43-99c5-3be61b7ccd34.mov

**But** if you hit swap button before the redirect we [hit this call](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257) to `prepareToLeaveSwaps`, which clears the swaps state

And before the state clearing process is complete the `signAndSendTransactions` call - [that is initiated when](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/view-quote/view-quote.js#L1018) you hit the `swap` button - goes through with the swaps state intact 
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257

once you arrive on the `awaiting-swaps` page, though the swap has been submitted correctly, the token information that we use to tell the user which token they will be receiving is no longer accessible since it is accessed through the now cleared `swapsState` (from the `SwapsController` in the background)

This PR fixes the issue by having the `await-swap` page fetch the swap transaction data from the transactions controller (where the state is persisted if the transaction is successfully initiated) rather than the swaps controller where the required state is cleared.

## More Information

* Fixes #16318

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Begin a Swap
2. Introduce amount
3. Introduce token
4. Click Review Swap
5. Terminate service worker -- you can proceed normally
6. Click Confirm Swap
7. Terminate service worker
8. Click Swap -- 
9. See that you do not land on an error page, you see the message: `Your <symbol of currency you are swapping for> will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.`
10. And see that the swap succeeds

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

commits.message: Adding bundle size at commit: c098c628cc1b7ac68f114b91f8331cc6519fe094

issue.title: Persisting segment events in MetaMetricsController store

labels.name: Extension QA Board
labels.description: Label will automate into QA workspace

issue.body:
Fixes #16173

PR address issue of segment events being lost in MV3 due to service worker restart. Events are now saved in MetaMetricsController store and resend to segment SDK till they are successfully submitted to segment.

issue.title: [e2e] Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation
With this PR we add Test Insights into the e2e tests runs, by adding the `xunit` reporting from mocha and inserting the `store_test_results` in the yml config file.


This will allow us to capture the following test metrics in circle-ci:

-  **Flaky Tests**: Flaky tests are tests that fail non-deterministically; they pass and fail due to some state external to the repository. Test insights detect flaky tests by identifying tests that failed and passed on the same commit in a 14-day window.
-  **Most Failed Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the lowest success rates in their most recent pipeline executions
-  **Slowest Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the longest run times in their most recent pipeline executions.


## More Information
* Closes #16366
* This is the same as we implemented for unit tests [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/15839)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Approach
For using [mocha cli reporting capabilities](https://mochajs.org/api/mocha#reporter) we need to change the way tests were run. We had 2 files, for running a single e2e testcase and all e2e testcases. The latter used a `for` loop, for running all the testcases. This made it not possible to use mocha reporter out of the box.

Since the e2e run scripts were not adding any extra functionality, that could not be achieved by `mocha cli,` both files have been removed and we are now using directly mocha cli commands.

This also unlocks other capabilities like continue to run testcases after failure, by using  `bail` flag, instead of building the functionality ourselves on the test run scripts, caching inside the `for` loop.  See workaround we did [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16194).


### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756677-bdcf6103-14f2-44a1-ad19-0fc01e1d947d.png)

When tests are failing, we'll be able to see which one directly on the job list and go directly to its traces

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756788-fd6a124e-8307-4389-bf68-49cfe9c6bffa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756955-42b0948a-04e8-4931-a3ee-c3a05fb3cc06.png)


## Manual Testing Steps
Check test insights from this branch [here](https://app.circleci.com/insights/github/MetaMask/metamask-extension/workflows/test_and_release/tests?branch=e2e-report).

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [X] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [X] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: [e2e] Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation
With this PR we add Test Insights into the e2e tests runs, by adding the `xunit` reporting from mocha and inserting the `store_test_results` in the yml config file.


This will allow us to capture the following test metrics in circle-ci:

-  **Flaky Tests**: Flaky tests are tests that fail non-deterministically; they pass and fail due to some state external to the repository. Test insights detect flaky tests by identifying tests that failed and passed on the same commit in a 14-day window.
-  **Most Failed Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the lowest success rates in their most recent pipeline executions
-  **Slowest Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the longest run times in their most recent pipeline executions.


## More Information
* Closes #16366
* This is the same as we implemented for unit tests [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/15839)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Approach
For using [mocha cli reporting capabilities](https://mochajs.org/api/mocha#reporter) we need to change the way tests were run. We had 2 files, for running a single e2e testcase and all e2e testcases. The latter used a `for` loop, for running all the testcases. This made it not possible to use mocha reporter out of the box.

Since the e2e run scripts were not adding any extra functionality, that could not be achieved by `mocha cli,` both files have been removed and we are now using directly mocha cli commands.

This also unlocks other capabilities like continue to run testcases after failure, by using  `bail` flag, instead of building the functionality ourselves on the test run scripts, caching inside the `for` loop.  See workaround we did [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16194).


### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756677-bdcf6103-14f2-44a1-ad19-0fc01e1d947d.png)

When tests are failing, we'll be able to see which one directly on the job list and go directly to its traces

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756788-fd6a124e-8307-4389-bf68-49cfe9c6bffa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756955-42b0948a-04e8-4931-a3ee-c3a05fb3cc06.png)


## Manual Testing Steps
Check test insights from this branch [here](https://app.circleci.com/insights/github/MetaMask/metamask-extension/workflows/test_and_release/tests?branch=e2e-report).

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [X] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [X] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.body: ## Explanation ### Housekeeping Checklist - [x] Has a `className` prop and the PropType descriptions are all the same - [x] Prop table in MDX docs have the "Accepts all Box component props" description and link - [x] We are consistent when using the same prop names like `size` and are suggesting the use of the generalized `design-system.js` constants e.g. `SIZES` as the primary option but noting the component consts in the documentation and using them for propType validation and storybook controls only - [x] Standardize all similar prop names for images `imgSrc`, `imgAlt`(html element + attribute) (needs audit) - [x] We have a story for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `export const Size = (args) => (` - [ ] Are multiple props stories allowed? e.g. `Color, Background Color And Border Color` story in `base-avatar` - [ ] yes when it makes sense to - [x] We have the accompanying documentation for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `### Size` - [x] All Base components follow the suffix convention e.g. `ButtonBase` - [x] All Base component MDX documentation have the base component notification at the top - [x] Add `mm-` prefix to all classNames - [x] className is kebab case version of the component name - [ ] Spread base components props and reduce duplication of props when props aren't being changed and remain the same for both variant and base components - [x] Remove `Component.displayName` not needed - [x] Add component to root `index.js` file in component-library - [ ] Add locals for any default text I18nContext as default context - [ ] Add any "to dos" with a `// TODO:` comment so we can search for them at a later date e.g. blocking components etc - [x] Add snapshot testing - [x] Add pixel values to propType descriptions if we use abstracted prop types that relate to pixel values e.g. `SIZE.MD (32px)` ## More Information Fixes: #16181 ## Screenshots/Screencaps ## Manual Testing Steps ```yarn test:unit:jest .ui/components/component-library/button-base/button-base.test.js``` ## Pre-Merge Checklist - [x] PR template is filled out - [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added - [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue - [x] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone ### + If there are functional changes: - [x] Manual testing complete & passed - [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Keep memstore contents after service worker restarts

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
Fixes #15954 

## Explanation

The memstore contents is usually lost when the MetaMask extension window is closed.
The problem however is that when Service Worker restarts, the memstore is also cleared. This should not be the case

This PR intends to solve this problem by copying the controllers in memtore to persistent store and adding a method to manually clear the store of the controllers when the MetaMask extension is closed.

## More Information

* See: #15828 
* 
Blocked By #15558 

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Open [test-dapp](https://metamask.github.io/test-dapp/)
2. Connect to MetaMask
3. Click on any of SIGN buttons
4. MetaMask window should open to the sign page
5. Open developer console and click on Application Tab
6. Stop service worker
7. Service worker should be restarted automatically 
8. The MetaMask sign window should still be open
9. Close the window.
10. Open the window again
11. The window should open to the home screen (not sign screen).

**NOTE**: This may be not fully testable until David's work on #15558 is fully completed. Because as of now, when service worker is restarted the user is logged out.

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [ ] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [ ] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Fix issue with awaiting swaps page

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
## Explanation

Currently when the service worker is terminated  immediately after a swap is initiated the `SwapsController` controlled `swapsState` is reset and so the `quotes` empty out along with other `fetchParams` causing a redirect:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L505  . So if you don't quickly hit the `swap` button on the `view quotes` page after terminating the SW you will be redirected back to the `build-quote` page:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34557516/199344799-5e705e69-f459-4f43-99c5-3be61b7ccd34.mov

**But** if you hit swap button before the redirect we [hit this call](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257) to `prepareToLeaveSwaps`, which clears the swaps state

And before the state clearing process is complete the `signAndSendTransactions` call - [that is initiated when](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/view-quote/view-quote.js#L1018) you hit the `swap` button - goes through with the swaps state intact 
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257

once you arrive on the `awaiting-swaps` page, though the swap has been submitted correctly, the token information that we use to tell the user which token they will be receiving is no longer accessible since it is accessed through the now cleared `swapsState` (from the `SwapsController` in the background)

This PR fixes the issue by having the `await-swap` page fetch the swap transaction data from the transactions controller (where the state is persisted if the transaction is successfully initiated) rather than the swaps controller where the required state is cleared.

## More Information

* Fixes #16318

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Begin a Swap
2. Introduce amount
3. Introduce token
4. Click Review Swap
5. Terminate service worker -- you can proceed normally
6. Click Confirm Swap
7. Terminate service worker
8. Click Swap -- 
9. See that you do not land on an error page, you see the message: `Your <symbol of currency you are swapping for> will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.`
10. And see that the swap succeeds

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Update PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md
issue.body:
## Explanation

<!--
Thanks for the pull request. Take a moment to answer these questions so that reviewers have the information they need to properly understand your changes:

* What is the current state of things and why does it need to change?
* What is the solution your changes offer and how does it work?

Below is a template to give you some ideas. Feel free to use your own words!

Currently, ...

This is a problem because ...

In order to solve this problem, this pull request ...
-->

## More Information

<!--
Are there any issues, Slack conversations, Zendesk issues, user stories, etc. reviewers should consult to understand this pull request better? For instance:

* Fixes #12345
* See: #67890
-->

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

<!-- How does it look now? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

## Manual Testing Steps

<!--
How should reviewers and QA manually test your changes? For instance:

- Go to this screen
- Do this
- Then do this
-->

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [ ] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [ ] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Unable to proceed with tx bc of inaccurate/overly aggressive "Insufficient funds for gas" warning #13087

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
As a user, I want a more informative “Insufficient funds for gas” warning on the send screen.

On the send screen, the user is shown an "Insufficient funds for gas" warning, but no other information about gas. So the user doesn't know if they have insufficient funds because prices are currently high or because the gas limit of the particular contract interaction they are attempting is high. So we show the estimated gas fee and warning message on the Send screen if user does not have enough tokens for the fee or total transaction amount is greater than the balance.

More info: https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/issues/13087

* First part for #13087 

## Screenshots

**BEFORE:**

**Expand view (UNI):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 13 50 48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194053999-141239a9-f144-48a4-8d96-160c7938af7f.png)

**AFTER:**

**Expand view (RopstenETH):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 11 23 42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194028085-2bdf4669-c46b-4e5f-9706-c722b300d02c.png)

**Expand view (UNI):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 11 25 13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194028202-51915a93-fb9d-4097-a1e3-4cd9a4a25c61.png)

**Expand view (GoerliETH):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 11 25 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194028263-ca95bb3e-3ac8-483f-a0cf-854906f068aa.png)

issue.title: Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation

<!--
Thanks for the pull request. Take a moment to answer these questions so that reviewers have the information they need to properly understand your changes:

* What is the current state of things and why does it need to change?
* What is the solution your changes offer and how does it work?

Below is a template to give you some ideas. Feel free to use your own words!

Currently, ...

This is a problem because ...

In order to solve this problem, this pull request ...
-->

## More Information

<!--
Are there any issues, Slack conversations, Zendesk issues, user stories, etc. reviewers should consult to understand this pull request better? For instance:

* Fixes #12345
* See: #67890
-->

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

<!-- How does it look now? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

## Manual Testing Steps

<!--
How should reviewers and QA manually test your changes? For instance:

- Go to this screen
- Do this
- Then do this
-->

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [ ] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [ ] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

PR address issue of segment events being lost in MV3 due to service worker restart. Events are now saved in MetaMetricsController store and resend to segment SDK till they are successfully submitted to segment.

issue.title: Adding HelpText component

labels.name: area-UI
labels.description: Relating to the user interface.

labels.name: IA/NAV
labels.description: Tickets related to the IA/NAV redesign

issue.body:
## Explanation

Adding `HelpText` component that will eventually be used with `TextField` and `Label`  to create `FormTextField`.

## More Information

* Fixes #16151
* [Figma Link](https://www.figma.com/file/HKpPKij9V3TpsyMV1TpV7C/DS-Components?node-id=7294%3A25180)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

### After


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8112138/198402952-2db1b8a2-62c6-4a40-b962-d417014d1d05.mov



## Manual Testing Steps

- Go to the latest build of Storybook in this PR
- Search `HelpText` in the search bar
- Check story controls
- Check stories
- Check docs

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [x] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [x] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [x] Manual testing complete & passed
- [x] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

### Acceptance Criteria
- [x] Has a `className` prop and the PropType descriptions are all the same
- [x] Prop table in MDX docs have the "Accepts all Box component props" description and link
- [x] We are consistent when using the same prop names like `size` and are suggesting the use of the generalized `design-system.js` constants e.g. `SIZES` as the primary option but noting the component consts in the documentation and using them for propType validation and storybook controls only
- [x] Standardize all similar prop names for images `imgSrc`, `imgAlt`(html element + attribute) (needs audit)
- [x] We have a story for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `export const Size = (args) => (`
- [x] We have the accompanying documentation for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `### Size`
- [x] Add `mm-` prefix to all classNames
- [x] className is kebab case version of the component name
- [x] Spread base components props and reduce duplication of props when props aren't being changed and remain the same for both variant and base components
- [x] Add any "to dos" with a `// TODO:` comment so we can search for them at a later date e.g. blocking components etc

issue.title: Fix issue with awaiting swaps page
issue.body:
## Explanation

Currently when the service worker is terminated  immediately after a swap is initiated the `SwapsController` controlled `swapsState` is reset and so the `quotes` empty out along with other `fetchParams` causing a redirect:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L505  . So if you don't quickly hit the `swap` button on the `view quotes` page after terminating the SW you will be redirected back to the `build-quote` page:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34557516/199344799-5e705e69-f459-4f43-99c5-3be61b7ccd34.mov

**But** if you hit swap button before the redirect we [hit this call](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257) to `prepareToLeaveSwaps`, which clears the swaps state

And before the state clearing process is complete the `signAndSendTransactions` call - [that is initiated when](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/view-quote/view-quote.js#L1018) you hit the `swap` button - goes through with the swaps state intact 
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257

once you arrive on the `awaiting-swaps` page, though the swap has been submitted correctly, the token information that we use to tell the user which token they will be receiving is no longer accessible since it is accessed through the now cleared `swapsState` (from the `SwapsController` in the background)

This PR fixes the issue by having the `await-swap` page fetch the swap transaction data from the transactions controller (where the state is persisted if the transaction is successfully initiated) rather than the swaps controller where the required state is cleared.

## More Information

* Fixes #16318

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Begin a Swap
2. Introduce amount
3. Introduce token
4. Click Review Swap
5. Terminate service worker -- you can proceed normally
6. Click Confirm Swap
7. Terminate service worker
8. Click Swap -- 
9. See that you do not land on an error page, you see the message: `Your <symbol of currency you are swapping for> will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.`
10. And see that the swap succeeds

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: chore: add bundle size diff to metamaskbot
issue.body:

Bundle size diffs [🚀 Bundle size reduced! 🚀]
  • background: -4
  • ui: -37940
  • common: -4

issue.title: wip: make network test helpers general to the provider type
issue.body:
Tests are all passing, but Ive commented out / singled out failing tests and wrapped them in an `if () {}`

Notes:

---
### Error format is different when hitting the max number of retries.

createJsonRpcClient error.message:
```
"JsonRpcEngine: Response has no error or result for request:
    {
      \"id\": 1280808420295549,
      \"jsonrpc\": \"2.0\",
      \"params\": [],
      \"method\": \"eth_getBlockByHash\"
    }"
```

createInfuraClient error.message:
```
InfuraProvider - cannot complete request. All retries exhausted.
    Original Error:
    {
      \"code\": -32603,
      \"message\": \"Gateway timeout. The request took too long to process. This can happen when querying logs over too wide a block range.\",
      \"stack\": \"Error: Gateway timeout. The request took too long to process. This can happen when querying logs over too wide a block range.\\n    at getEthJsonRpcError ( BIG LONG STACK TRACE INTO eth-json-rpc-errors
    }·
    "
```

#### examples of ignoring tests because of this:
- [testsForRpcMethodAssumingNoBlockParam -> `causes a request to fail with a custom error if the request to ${providerType} provider returns a ${httpStatus} response 5 times in a row`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R367)
- [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `causes a request to fail with a custom error if the request to ${providerType} provider returns a ${httpStatus} response 5 times in a row`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1096)


---

### Caching inconsistencies

#### examples
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `hits ${providerType} provider and does not reuse the result of a previous request if the latest block number was updated since`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R741)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `reuses the result of a previous request even if the latest block number was updated since`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1287)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> 'when setting blockParamType === earliest'](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1367)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `given a block tag of "pending"`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1515)

---

issue.title: [Bug]: Balance does not update on duplicate chainId network #13690

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body: ## Explanation Currently, the balance of an account won't update if the network selected has a chainId that is already present in Metamask. That happens because in account-tracker.js there is a check for chainId and if it belonged to known networks ( as in this case it was Ropsten network) it called the method that checked balance on Ropsten network and not localhost as it should. In order to solve this problem, I added if statement that checks if rpcUrl is localhost and in that case the right method (updateBalance) is being called. ## More information * Fixes #13690 ## Screenshots/Screencaps ### Before ### After

issue.title: Fix issue with awaiting swaps page

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
## Explanation

Currently when the service worker is terminated  immediately after a swap is initiated the `SwapsController` controlled `swapsState` is reset and so the `quotes` empty out along with other `fetchParams` causing a redirect:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L505  . So if you don't quickly hit the `swap` button on the `view quotes` page after terminating the SW you will be redirected back to the `build-quote` page:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34557516/199344799-5e705e69-f459-4f43-99c5-3be61b7ccd34.mov

**But** if you hit swap button before the redirect we [hit this call](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257) to `prepareToLeaveSwaps`, which clears the swaps state

And before the state clearing process is complete the `signAndSendTransactions` call - [that is initiated when](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/view-quote/view-quote.js#L1018) you hit the `swap` button - goes through with the swaps state intact 
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257

once you arrive on the `awaiting-swaps` page, though the swap has been submitted correctly, the token information that we use to tell the user which token they will be receiving is no longer accessible since it is accessed through the now cleared `swapsState` (from the `SwapsController` in the background)

This PR fixes the issue by having the `await-swap` page fetch the swap transaction data from the transactions controller (where the state is persisted if the transaction is successfully initiated) rather than the swaps controller where the required state is cleared.

## More Information

* Fixes #16318

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Begin a Swap
2. Introduce amount
3. Introduce token
4. Click Review Swap
5. Terminate service worker -- you can proceed normally
6. Click Confirm Swap
7. Terminate service worker
8. Click Swap -- 
9. See that you do not land on an error page, you see the message: `Your <symbol of currency you are swapping for> will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.`
10. And see that the swap succeeds

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

commits.message: Adding bundle size at commit: c098c628cc1b7ac68f114b91f8331cc6519fe094

issue.title: Persisting segment events in MetaMetricsController store

labels.name: Extension QA Board
labels.description: Label will automate into QA workspace

issue.body:
Fixes #16173

PR address issue of segment events being lost in MV3 due to service worker restart. Events are now saved in MetaMetricsController store and resend to segment SDK till they are successfully submitted to segment.

issue.title: [e2e] Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation
With this PR we add Test Insights into the e2e tests runs, by adding the `xunit` reporting from mocha and inserting the `store_test_results` in the yml config file.


This will allow us to capture the following test metrics in circle-ci:

-  **Flaky Tests**: Flaky tests are tests that fail non-deterministically; they pass and fail due to some state external to the repository. Test insights detect flaky tests by identifying tests that failed and passed on the same commit in a 14-day window.
-  **Most Failed Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the lowest success rates in their most recent pipeline executions
-  **Slowest Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the longest run times in their most recent pipeline executions.


## More Information
* Closes #16366
* This is the same as we implemented for unit tests [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/15839)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Approach
For using [mocha cli reporting capabilities](https://mochajs.org/api/mocha#reporter) we need to change the way tests were run. We had 2 files, for running a single e2e testcase and all e2e testcases. The latter used a `for` loop, for running all the testcases. This made it not possible to use mocha reporter out of the box.

Since the e2e run scripts were not adding any extra functionality, that could not be achieved by `mocha cli,` both files have been removed and we are now using directly mocha cli commands.

This also unlocks other capabilities like continue to run testcases after failure, by using  `bail` flag, instead of building the functionality ourselves on the test run scripts, caching inside the `for` loop.  See workaround we did [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16194).


### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756677-bdcf6103-14f2-44a1-ad19-0fc01e1d947d.png)

When tests are failing, we'll be able to see which one directly on the job list and go directly to its traces

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756788-fd6a124e-8307-4389-bf68-49cfe9c6bffa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756955-42b0948a-04e8-4931-a3ee-c3a05fb3cc06.png)


## Manual Testing Steps
Check test insights from this branch [here](https://app.circleci.com/insights/github/MetaMask/metamask-extension/workflows/test_and_release/tests?branch=e2e-report).

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [X] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [X] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: [e2e] Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation
With this PR we add Test Insights into the e2e tests runs, by adding the `xunit` reporting from mocha and inserting the `store_test_results` in the yml config file.


This will allow us to capture the following test metrics in circle-ci:

-  **Flaky Tests**: Flaky tests are tests that fail non-deterministically; they pass and fail due to some state external to the repository. Test insights detect flaky tests by identifying tests that failed and passed on the same commit in a 14-day window.
-  **Most Failed Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the lowest success rates in their most recent pipeline executions
-  **Slowest Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the longest run times in their most recent pipeline executions.


## More Information
* Closes #16366
* This is the same as we implemented for unit tests [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/15839)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Approach
For using [mocha cli reporting capabilities](https://mochajs.org/api/mocha#reporter) we need to change the way tests were run. We had 2 files, for running a single e2e testcase and all e2e testcases. The latter used a `for` loop, for running all the testcases. This made it not possible to use mocha reporter out of the box.

Since the e2e run scripts were not adding any extra functionality, that could not be achieved by `mocha cli,` both files have been removed and we are now using directly mocha cli commands.

This also unlocks other capabilities like continue to run testcases after failure, by using  `bail` flag, instead of building the functionality ourselves on the test run scripts, caching inside the `for` loop.  See workaround we did [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16194).


### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756677-bdcf6103-14f2-44a1-ad19-0fc01e1d947d.png)

When tests are failing, we'll be able to see which one directly on the job list and go directly to its traces

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756788-fd6a124e-8307-4389-bf68-49cfe9c6bffa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756955-42b0948a-04e8-4931-a3ee-c3a05fb3cc06.png)


## Manual Testing Steps
Check test insights from this branch [here](https://app.circleci.com/insights/github/MetaMask/metamask-extension/workflows/test_and_release/tests?branch=e2e-report).

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [X] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [X] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: button base housekeeping
issue.body: ## Explanation ### Housekeeping Checklist - [x] Has a `className` prop and the PropType descriptions are all the same - [x] Prop table in MDX docs have the "Accepts all Box component props" description and link - [x] We are consistent when using the same prop names like `size` and are suggesting the use of the generalized `design-system.js` constants e.g. `SIZES` as the primary option but noting the component consts in the documentation and using them for propType validation and storybook controls only - [x] Standardize all similar prop names for images `imgSrc`, `imgAlt`(html element + attribute) (needs audit) - [x] We have a story for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `export const Size = (args) => (` - [ ] Are multiple props stories allowed? e.g. `Color, Background Color And Border Color` story in `base-avatar` - [ ] yes when it makes sense to - [x] We have the accompanying documentation for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `### Size` - [x] All Base components follow the suffix convention e.g. `ButtonBase` - [x] All Base component MDX documentation have the base component notification at the top - [x] Add `mm-` prefix to all classNames - [x] className is kebab case version of the component name - [ ] Spread base components props and reduce duplication of props when props aren't being changed and remain the same for both variant and base components - [x] Remove `Component.displayName` not needed - [x] Add component to root `index.js` file in component-library - [ ] Add locals for any default text I18nContext as default context - [ ] Add any "to dos" with a `// TODO:` comment so we can search for them at a later date e.g. blocking components etc - [x] Add snapshot testing - [x] Add pixel values to propType descriptions if we use abstracted prop types that relate to pixel values e.g. `SIZE.MD (32px)` ## More Information Fixes: #16181 ## Screenshots/Screencaps ## Manual Testing Steps ```yarn test:unit:jest .ui/components/component-library/button-base/button-base.test.js``` ## Pre-Merge Checklist - [x] PR template is filled out - [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added - [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue - [x] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone ### + If there are functional changes: - [x] Manual testing complete & passed - [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Keep memstore contents after service worker restarts

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
Fixes #15954 

## Explanation

The memstore contents is usually lost when the MetaMask extension window is closed.
The problem however is that when Service Worker restarts, the memstore is also cleared. This should not be the case

This PR intends to solve this problem by copying the controllers in memtore to persistent store and adding a method to manually clear the store of the controllers when the MetaMask extension is closed.

## More Information

* See: #15828 
* 
Blocked By #15558 

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Open [test-dapp](https://metamask.github.io/test-dapp/)
2. Connect to MetaMask
3. Click on any of SIGN buttons
4. MetaMask window should open to the sign page
5. Open developer console and click on Application Tab
6. Stop service worker
7. Service worker should be restarted automatically 
8. The MetaMask sign window should still be open
9. Close the window.
10. Open the window again
11. The window should open to the home screen (not sign screen).

**NOTE**: This may be not fully testable until David's work on #15558 is fully completed. Because as of now, when service worker is restarted the user is logged out.

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [ ] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [ ] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Fix issue with awaiting swaps page

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
## Explanation

Currently when the service worker is terminated  immediately after a swap is initiated the `SwapsController` controlled `swapsState` is reset and so the `quotes` empty out along with other `fetchParams` causing a redirect:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L505  . So if you don't quickly hit the `swap` button on the `view quotes` page after terminating the SW you will be redirected back to the `build-quote` page:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34557516/199344799-5e705e69-f459-4f43-99c5-3be61b7ccd34.mov

**But** if you hit swap button before the redirect we [hit this call](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257) to `prepareToLeaveSwaps`, which clears the swaps state

And before the state clearing process is complete the `signAndSendTransactions` call - [that is initiated when](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/view-quote/view-quote.js#L1018) you hit the `swap` button - goes through with the swaps state intact 
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257

once you arrive on the `awaiting-swaps` page, though the swap has been submitted correctly, the token information that we use to tell the user which token they will be receiving is no longer accessible since it is accessed through the now cleared `swapsState` (from the `SwapsController` in the background)

This PR fixes the issue by having the `await-swap` page fetch the swap transaction data from the transactions controller (where the state is persisted if the transaction is successfully initiated) rather than the swaps controller where the required state is cleared.

## More Information

* Fixes #16318

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Begin a Swap
2. Introduce amount
3. Introduce token
4. Click Review Swap
5. Terminate service worker -- you can proceed normally
6. Click Confirm Swap
7. Terminate service worker
8. Click Swap -- 
9. See that you do not land on an error page, you see the message: `Your <symbol of currency you are swapping for> will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.`
10. And see that the swap succeeds

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Update PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md
issue.body:
## Explanation

<!--
Thanks for the pull request. Take a moment to answer these questions so that reviewers have the information they need to properly understand your changes:

* What is the current state of things and why does it need to change?
* What is the solution your changes offer and how does it work?

Below is a template to give you some ideas. Feel free to use your own words!

Currently, ...

This is a problem because ...

In order to solve this problem, this pull request ...
-->

## More Information

<!--
Are there any issues, Slack conversations, Zendesk issues, user stories, etc. reviewers should consult to understand this pull request better? For instance:

* Fixes #12345
* See: #67890
-->

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

<!-- How does it look now? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

## Manual Testing Steps

<!--
How should reviewers and QA manually test your changes? For instance:

- Go to this screen
- Do this
- Then do this
-->

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [ ] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [ ] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: Unable to proceed with tx bc of inaccurate/overly aggressive "Insufficient funds for gas" warning #13087

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
As a user, I want a more informative “Insufficient funds for gas” warning on the send screen.

On the send screen, the user is shown an "Insufficient funds for gas" warning, but no other information about gas. So the user doesn't know if they have insufficient funds because prices are currently high or because the gas limit of the particular contract interaction they are attempting is high. So we show the estimated gas fee and warning message on the Send screen if user does not have enough tokens for the fee or total transaction amount is greater than the balance.

More info: https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/issues/13087

* First part for #13087 

## Screenshots

**BEFORE:**

**Expand view (RopstenETH):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 13 49 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194053714-af4c88eb-eb1e-40bb-b491-d0966e7b569f.png)

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 13 50 48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194053999-141239a9-f144-48a4-8d96-160c7938af7f.png)

**AFTER:**

**Expand view (RopstenETH):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 11 23 42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194028085-2bdf4669-c46b-4e5f-9706-c722b300d02c.png)

**Expand view (UNI):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 11 25 13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194028202-51915a93-fb9d-4097-a1e3-4cd9a4a25c61.png)

**Expand view (GoerliETH):**

![Screenshot 2022-10-05 at 11 25 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92527393/194028263-ca95bb3e-3ac8-483f-a0cf-854906f068aa.png)

## Screencaps

issue.title: Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation

<!--
Thanks for the pull request. Take a moment to answer these questions so that reviewers have the information they need to properly understand your changes:

* What is the current state of things and why does it need to change?
* What is the solution your changes offer and how does it work?

Below is a template to give you some ideas. Feel free to use your own words!

Currently, ...

This is a problem because ...

In order to solve this problem, this pull request ...
-->

## More Information

<!--
Are there any issues, Slack conversations, Zendesk issues, user stories, etc. reviewers should consult to understand this pull request better? For instance:

* Fixes #12345
* See: #67890
-->

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

<!-- How does it look now? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

## Manual Testing Steps

<!--
How should reviewers and QA manually test your changes? For instance:

- Go to this screen
- Do this
- Then do this
-->

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [ ] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [ ] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

The PR improves DAPP action replay. As the background is loaded and its state is completely initialised a message is sent to inpage provider to replay actions.

To be merged after this PR is merged: https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16075

issue.title: Persisting segment events in MetaMetricsController store

labels.name: Extension QA Board
labels.description: Label will automate into QA workspace

issue.body:
Fixes #16173

PR address issue of segment events being lost in MV3 due to service worker restart. Events are now saved in MetaMetricsController store and resend to segment SDK till they are successfully submitted to segment.

issue.title: Adding HelpText component

labels.name: area-UI
labels.description: Relating to the user interface.

labels.name: IA/NAV
labels.description: Tickets related to the IA/NAV redesign

issue.body:
## Explanation

Adding `HelpText` component that will eventually be used with `TextField` and `Label`  to create `FormTextField`.

## More Information

* Fixes #16151
* [Figma Link](https://www.figma.com/file/HKpPKij9V3TpsyMV1TpV7C/DS-Components?node-id=7294%3A25180)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

### After


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8112138/198402952-2db1b8a2-62c6-4a40-b962-d417014d1d05.mov



## Manual Testing Steps

- Go to the latest build of Storybook in this PR
- Search `HelpText` in the search bar
- Check story controls
- Check stories
- Check docs

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [x] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [x] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [x] Manual testing complete & passed
- [x] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

### Acceptance Criteria
- [x] Has a `className` prop and the PropType descriptions are all the same
- [x] Prop table in MDX docs have the "Accepts all Box component props" description and link
- [x] We are consistent when using the same prop names like `size` and are suggesting the use of the generalized `design-system.js` constants e.g. `SIZES` as the primary option but noting the component consts in the documentation and using them for propType validation and storybook controls only
- [x] Standardize all similar prop names for images `imgSrc`, `imgAlt`(html element + attribute) (needs audit)
- [x] We have a story for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `export const Size = (args) => (`
- [x] We have the accompanying documentation for each component prop and we use the prop name verbatim e.g. `size` prop would be `### Size`
- [x] Add `mm-` prefix to all classNames
- [x] className is kebab case version of the component name
- [x] Spread base components props and reduce duplication of props when props aren't being changed and remain the same for both variant and base components
- [x] Add any "to dos" with a `// TODO:` comment so we can search for them at a later date e.g. blocking components etc

issue.title: Fix issue with awaiting swaps page
issue.body:
## Explanation

Currently when the service worker is terminated  immediately after a swap is initiated the `SwapsController` controlled `swapsState` is reset and so the `quotes` empty out along with other `fetchParams` causing a redirect:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L505  . So if you don't quickly hit the `swap` button on the `view quotes` page after terminating the SW you will be redirected back to the `build-quote` page:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34557516/199344799-5e705e69-f459-4f43-99c5-3be61b7ccd34.mov

**But** if you hit swap button before the redirect we [hit this call](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257) to `prepareToLeaveSwaps`, which clears the swaps state

And before the state clearing process is complete the `signAndSendTransactions` call - [that is initiated when](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/view-quote/view-quote.js#L1018) you hit the `swap` button - goes through with the swaps state intact 
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257

once you arrive on the `awaiting-swaps` page, though the swap has been submitted correctly, the token information that we use to tell the user which token they will be receiving is no longer accessible since it is accessed through the now cleared `swapsState` (from the `SwapsController` in the background)

This PR fixes the issue by having the `await-swap` page fetch the swap transaction data from the transactions controller (where the state is persisted if the transaction is successfully initiated) rather than the swaps controller where the required state is cleared.

## More Information

* Fixes #16318

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Begin a Swap
2. Introduce amount
3. Introduce token
4. Click Review Swap
5. Terminate service worker -- you can proceed normally
6. Click Confirm Swap
7. Terminate service worker
8. Click Swap -- 
9. See that you do not land on an error page, you see the message: `Your <symbol of currency you are swapping for> will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.`
10. And see that the swap succeeds

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

commits.message: Adding bundle size at commit: a9839688fbd455a20afe00fe3f06d83cfd861409

issue.title: chore: add bundle size diff to metamaskbot
issue.body:
## Explanation This PR adds Bundle size diff between the `PR branch` and latest on `develop` and shows an alert if the bundle size of `common` + `background` is increased since last version on develop. ## More Information * Fixes #16070 ## Manual Testing Steps After pushing to a PR, if the build is successful the Metamask bot should also show the following section:
Bundle size diffs [🚀 Bundle size reduced! 🚀]
  • background: -4
  • ui: -37940
  • common: -4
## Pre-Merge Checklist - [x] PR template is filled out - [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added - [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue - [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone ### + If there are functional changes: - [x] Manual testing complete & passed - [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

issue.title: wip: make network test helpers general to the provider type
issue.body:
Tests are all passing, but Ive commented out / singled out failing tests and wrapped them in an `if () {}`

Notes:

---
### Error format is different when hitting the max number of retries.

createJsonRpcClient error.message:
```
"JsonRpcEngine: Response has no error or result for request:
    {
      \"id\": 1280808420295549,
      \"jsonrpc\": \"2.0\",
      \"params\": [],
      \"method\": \"eth_getBlockByHash\"
    }"
```

createInfuraClient error.message:
```
InfuraProvider - cannot complete request. All retries exhausted.
    Original Error:
    {
      \"code\": -32603,
      \"message\": \"Gateway timeout. The request took too long to process. This can happen when querying logs over too wide a block range.\",
      \"stack\": \"Error: Gateway timeout. The request took too long to process. This can happen when querying logs over too wide a block range.\\n    at getEthJsonRpcError ( BIG LONG STACK TRACE INTO eth-json-rpc-errors
    }·
    "
```

#### examples of ignoring tests because of this:
- [testsForRpcMethodAssumingNoBlockParam -> `causes a request to fail with a custom error if the request to ${providerType} provider returns a ${httpStatus} response 5 times in a row`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R367)
- [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `causes a request to fail with a custom error if the request to ${providerType} provider returns a ${httpStatus} response 5 times in a row`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1096)


---

### Caching inconsistencies

#### examples
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `hits ${providerType} provider and does not reuse the result of a previous request if the latest block number was updated since`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R741)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `reuses the result of a previous request even if the latest block number was updated since`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1287)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> 'when setting blockParamType === earliest'](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1367)
 - [testsForRpcMethodSupportingBlockParam -> `given a block tag of "pending"`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16337/files#diff-75270c92781195b2394e09df05ae088564d20d820fa15ab45b26b5527df6c9b7R1515)

---

issue.body: ## Explanation Currently, the balance of an account won't update if the network selected has a chainId that is already present in Metamask. That happens because in account-tracker.js there is a check for chainId and if it belonged to known networks ( as in this case it was Ropsten network) it called the method that checked balance on Ropsten network and not localhost as it should. In order to solve this problem, I added if statement that checks if rpcUrl is localhost and in that case the right method (updateBalance) is being called. ## More information * Fixes #13690 ## Screenshots/Screencaps ### Before ### After

issue.title: Fix issue with awaiting swaps page

labels.name: PR - P1
labels.description: identifies PRs deemed priority for Extension team

issue.body:
## Explanation

Currently when the service worker is terminated  immediately after a swap is initiated the `SwapsController` controlled `swapsState` is reset and so the `quotes` empty out along with other `fetchParams` causing a redirect:
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L505  . So if you don't quickly hit the `swap` button on the `view quotes` page after terminating the SW you will be redirected back to the `build-quote` page:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34557516/199344799-5e705e69-f459-4f43-99c5-3be61b7ccd34.mov

**But** if you hit swap button before the redirect we [hit this call](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257) to `prepareToLeaveSwaps`, which clears the swaps state

And before the state clearing process is complete the `signAndSendTransactions` call - [that is initiated when](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/view-quote/view-quote.js#L1018) you hit the `swap` button - goes through with the swaps state intact 
https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/ui/pages/swaps/index.js#L257

once you arrive on the `awaiting-swaps` page, though the swap has been submitted correctly, the token information that we use to tell the user which token they will be receiving is no longer accessible since it is accessed through the now cleared `swapsState` (from the `SwapsController` in the background)

This PR fixes the issue by having the `await-swap` page fetch the swap transaction data from the transactions controller (where the state is persisted if the transaction is successfully initiated) rather than the swaps controller where the required state is cleared.

## More Information

* Fixes #16318

## Manual Testing Steps

1. Begin a Swap
2. Introduce amount
3. Introduce token
4. Click Review Swap
5. Terminate service worker -- you can proceed normally
6. Click Confirm Swap
7. Terminate service worker
8. Click Swap -- 
9. See that you do not land on an error page, you see the message: `Your <symbol of currency you are swapping for> will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.`
10. And see that the swap succeeds

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [x] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [x] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied

commits.message: Adding bundle size at commit: c098c628cc1b7ac68f114b91f8331cc6519fe094

issue.title: Persisting segment events in MetaMetricsController store

labels.name: Extension QA Board
labels.description: Label will automate into QA workspace

issue.body:
Fixes #16173

PR address issue of segment events being lost in MV3 due to service worker restart. Events are now saved in MetaMetricsController store and resend to segment SDK till they are successfully submitted to segment.

issue.title: [e2e] Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation
With this PR we add Test Insights into the e2e tests runs, by adding the `xunit` reporting from mocha and inserting the `store_test_results` in the yml config file.


This will allow us to capture the following test metrics in circle-ci:

-  **Flaky Tests**: Flaky tests are tests that fail non-deterministically; they pass and fail due to some state external to the repository. Test insights detect flaky tests by identifying tests that failed and passed on the same commit in a 14-day window.
-  **Most Failed Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the lowest success rates in their most recent pipeline executions
-  **Slowest Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the longest run times in their most recent pipeline executions.


## More Information
* Closes #16366
* This is the same as we implemented for unit tests [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/15839)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Approach
For using [mocha cli reporting capabilities](https://mochajs.org/api/mocha#reporter) we need to change the way tests were run. We had 2 files, for running a single e2e testcase and all e2e testcases. The latter used a `for` loop, for running all the testcases. This made it not possible to use mocha reporter out of the box.

Since the e2e run scripts were not adding any extra functionality, that could not be achieved by `mocha cli,` both files have been removed and we are now using directly mocha cli commands.

This also unlocks other capabilities like continue to run testcases after failure, by using  `bail` flag, instead of building the functionality ourselves on the test run scripts, caching inside the `for` loop.  See workaround we did [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16194).


### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756677-bdcf6103-14f2-44a1-ad19-0fc01e1d947d.png)

When tests are failing, we'll be able to see which one directly on the job list and go directly to its traces

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756788-fd6a124e-8307-4389-bf68-49cfe9c6bffa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756955-42b0948a-04e8-4931-a3ee-c3a05fb3cc06.png)


## Manual Testing Steps
Check test insights from this branch [here](https://app.circleci.com/insights/github/MetaMask/metamask-extension/workflows/test_and_release/tests?branch=e2e-report).

issue.title: [e2e] Add e2e test reports for getting circle ci insights
issue.body:
## Explanation
With this PR we add Test Insights into the e2e tests runs, by adding the `xunit` reporting from mocha and inserting the `store_test_results` in the yml config file.


This will allow us to capture the following test metrics in circle-ci:

-  **Flaky Tests**: Flaky tests are tests that fail non-deterministically; they pass and fail due to some state external to the repository. Test insights detect flaky tests by identifying tests that failed and passed on the same commit in a 14-day window.
-  **Most Failed Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the lowest success rates in their most recent pipeline executions
-  **Slowest Tests**: You can view the 100 tests with the longest run times in their most recent pipeline executions.


## More Information
* Closes #16366
* This is the same as we implemented for unit tests [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/15839)

## Screenshots/Screencaps

<!-- If you're making a change to the UI, make sure to capture a screenshot or a short video showing off your work! -->

### Approach
For using [mocha cli reporting capabilities](https://mochajs.org/api/mocha#reporter) we need to change the way tests were run. We had 2 files, for running a single e2e testcase and all e2e testcases. The latter used a `for` loop, for running all the testcases. This made it not possible to use mocha reporter out of the box.

Since the e2e run scripts were not adding any extra functionality, that could not be achieved by `mocha cli,` both files have been removed and we are now using directly mocha cli commands.

This also unlocks other capabilities like continue to run testcases after failure, by using  `bail` flag, instead of building the functionality ourselves on the test run scripts, caching inside the `for` loop.  See workaround we did [here](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/16194).


### Before

<!-- How did the UI you changed look before your changes? Drag your file(s) below this line: -->

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756677-bdcf6103-14f2-44a1-ad19-0fc01e1d947d.png)

When tests are failing, we'll be able to see which one directly on the job list and go directly to its traces

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756788-fd6a124e-8307-4389-bf68-49cfe9c6bffa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54408225/199756955-42b0948a-04e8-4931-a3ee-c3a05fb3cc06.png)


## Manual Testing Steps
Check test insights from this branch [here](https://app.circleci.com/insights/github/MetaMask/metamask-extension/workflows/test_and_release/tests?branch=e2e-report).

## Pre-Merge Checklist

- [X] PR template is filled out
- [ ] **IF** this PR fixes a bug, a test that _would have_ caught the bug has been added
- [X] PR is linked to the appropriate GitHub issue
- [ ] PR has been added to the appropriate release Milestone

### + If there are functional changes:

- [ ] Manual testing complete & passed
- [ ] "Extension QA Board" label has been applied
